name: AT & T v. The PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION. Petition of the DELAWARE AND HUDSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.; SPRINT COMMUNICATIONS CO., L.P. v. The PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION. Petition of the DELAWARE AND HUDSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
name_abbreviation: AT & T v. Pennsylvania Public Utility Commission
docket_number: Petition Nos. 306 and 307 M.D. Alloc. Dkt. 1998

parties: AT & T v. The PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION. Petition of the DELAWARE AND HUDSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC. SPRINT COMMUNICATIONS CO., L.P. v. The PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION. Petition of the DELAWARE AND HUDSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
AND NOW, this 23rd day of September, 1998, Delaware’s Petition for Allowance of Appeal is hereby GRANTED, limited to issues numbered 1, 2, 3, 6 and 7.
This matter is hereby consolidated with 296 and 297 M.D. Alloc. Dkt.1998.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: William J. Kennedy, Christopher D. Loizides, Selena Fitanides, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
Lawrence F. Barth, Asst. Counsel, Bohdan R. Pankiw, Acting Chief Counsel, for Pennsylvania Public Utility Com’n.
casebody.head_matter:
717 A.2d 1022
AT & T v. The PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION. Petition of the DELAWARE AND HUDSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC. SPRINT COMMUNICATIONS CO., L.P. v. The PENNSYLVANIA PUBLIC UTILITY COMMISSION. Petition of the DELAWARE AND HUDSON RAILWAY COMPANY, INC.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Sept. 23, 1998.
William J. Kennedy, Christopher D. Loizides, Selena Fitanides, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
Lawrence F. Barth, Asst. Counsel, Bohdan R. Pankiw, Acting Chief Counsel, for Pennsylvania Public Utility Com’n.
